title: The Medieval Islamic Civilization-Collection13 (History,Legacy4)
description:
The Medieval Islamic Civilization - Collection 13 (History and Legacy 4):

Here is another special uploads (4 of them) about the Islamic civilization in the medieval period. We start with this one which has 15 titles:

-  Burnett et al (Eds.) - Studies in the History of the Exact Sciences in Honour of David Pingree (2004)

-  Crone & Hinds - God's Caliph; Religious Authority in the First Centuries of Islam (1986)

-  Elad - Medieval Jerusalem and Islamic Worship; Holy Places, Ceremonies, Pilgrimage (1999)

-  Grunebaum - Classical Islam; a History, 600 A.D. to 1258 A.D. (1970)

-  Haskins - Studies in the History of Medieval Science (1924)

-  James - Early Islamic Spain; the History of Ibn al-Qutiya (2009)

-  Lapidus - A History of Islamic Societies, 3e (2014)

-  Lewis - God's Crucible; Islam and the Making of Europe, 570-1215 (2008)

-  Lindberg & Shank (Eds.) The Cambridge History of Science, Vol. 2, Medieval Science (2013)

-  Nightingale - Granada; a Pomegranate in the Hand of God (2015)

-  Starr - Lost Enlightenment; Central Asia's Golden Age from the Arab Conquest to Tamerlane (2013)

-  The New Cambridge History of Islam; Vol. 1, the Formation of the Islamic World, 6th to 11th Centuries, Ed. C.F. Robinson (2010)

-  The New Cambridge History of Islam; Vol. 2, the Western Islamic World, 11th to 18th Centuries, Ed. M. Fierro (2010)

-  The New Cambridge History of Islam; Vol. 3, the Eastern Islamic World, 11th to 18th Centuries, Eds. Morgan & Reid (2010)

-  The New Cambridge History of Islam; Vol. 4, Islamic Cultures and Societies to the End of the 18th Century, Ed. R. Irwin (2010)
